H0.text: Of which reptile are there only two species, one living in the Mississippi and the other in China. Crocodile

H1.text: Of which reptile are there only two species, one living in the Mississippi and the other in China. Turtle

H2.text: Of which reptile are there only two species, one living in the Mississippi and the other in China. Caiman

H3.text: Of which reptile are there only two species, one living in the Mississippi and the other in China. Aligator

A4.text: The two extant species are the American alligator (A. mississippiensis) and the Chinese alligator (A. sinensis).

A5.text: The genus Alligator belongs to the subfamily Alligatorinae, which is the sister taxon to Caimaninae (the caimans).
